DOC.brief_summary: This study aims to perform x-ray diffraction analysis of blinded hair samples from women with a documented health status, to validate the previous findings of James et al who described that x-ray diffraction patterns of human hair can distinguish samples from healthy subjects from those of diseased subjects, specifically those suffering from breast cancer. The primary hypothesis is that x-ray diffraction of hair can be used to distinguish hair from patients with confirmed breast cancer from subjects without detectable breast cancer.
DOC.brief_title: Use of Hair to Diagnose Breast Cancer
DOC.criteria: Adult women (aged >20) who are undergoing mammography, and Who are willing and able to provide informed consent; and Who have usable scalp hair Women with a history of breast cancer ever or other cancers (excluding nonmelanoma skin cancer and CIN: cervical intraepithelial neoplasia) within 5 years.
